item.description:
Process Work: Dreaming While Awake with Matt Stella

The group meets from 11:30 - 1:30 pm. The first hour is a potluck lunch and a chance to get to know members better. The second hour is the presentation.

$10 meetup fee.

PROCESS WORK: Dreaming While Awake

Process Work is an innovative awareness practice that supports individuals
and collectives to get along with themselves and the world around them.
Expanding on Jung's teleological approach to dreams and synchronicity,
Jungian analyst and physicist, Dr. Arnold Mindell theorized the "Dreambody"
concept, a unifying background pattern or dream that manifests in all
perceptual channels. From this perspective, we experience the "Dreaming
Process" in a myriad of ways; through our nighttime dreams as well as the
organic flow of waking experience. Please join Matt Stella in learning some
beginning tools to following "the Dreaming". When we approach all of our
experiences as dreams, then problems and conflicts transform, and life
becomes creative and meaningful.

BIO:
Matt Stella, LICSW, Dipl.PW is a psychotherapist, group facilitator, and
Process Work Diplomate, holding a Masters in Process Work from the Process
Work Institute in Portland, OR. He has been in private practice in Salt
Lake City since 2001, and has just relocated his practice to Salem, MA this
year. He offers his healing and awareness work with individuals, couples
and groups on the North Shore and in Cambridge.
item.name: January Boston Area Mind-Body Therapies Meetup
